page.title: 02FARMING IN BURNESS
page.content: {Large farms}predominate in this particular block (e.g. Hermisgarth, Westbrough & Odinsgarth) but this is {not}typical of most of Sanday.{Small {crofts}predominate in other parts.Over the last 40 years, the large Burness farms have been gradually{absorbing the smaller crofts (e.g.Thorness & Thornesshill are now owned by Hermisgarth; Lochend is farmed by Garbo; & Howland & Skithow are farmed by Woodhouse). The large farms concentrate on{breeding cattle & sheep & the{crops}grown are for{fodder}for the animals _ mainly{silage, hay, {barley, oats}& some{turnips.}Barley is grown in a field for 2 or 3 years & then it is sown with grass for 6 or 7 years to let the soil recover some of its goodness.{No}Burness farmer produces{milk commercially}_ all the milk produced is given to the calves.
